data.name: Suspicious PowerShell Process Ancestry
data.description: Detects execution of the PowerShell script interpreter by atypical parent processes. Office macro malware attacks often employ this technique. The signal looks for PowerShell spawned by the CSCRIPT.EXE, WSCRIPT.EXE, or MSHTA.EXE interpreters, as well as by the Microsoft Word or Excel applications, to cover both direct and indirect execution.

data.name: BITSADMIN File Retrieval and Execution
data.description: The Background Intelligent Transfer Service (BITS) is a built-in Windows utility that can be used to download and execute files, as well as upload files, to a URL. Direct execution of the BITSADMIN utility is uncommon, and may be abused to retrieve and run malware or transfer other files. Recurrent BITS jobs can also be used as a persistence mechanism.
data.contents: process.path ends with '\\bitsadmin.exe' AND ((process.command_line contains 'http' AND (process.command_line contains '/AddFile' OR process.command_line contains '/transfer')) OR ((process.command_line contains '/SetNotifyCmdLine' AND process.command_line contains '/AddFile') OR process.command_line contains '/setproxysettings')) AND process.command_line contains NOT '\\DSS'

data.contents: group(file.operation is 'create' AND file.path contains '\\apppatch' AND file.path contains '.sdb' AND file.path contains NOT '\\Custom')

data.name: GlobalFlags Persistence
data.description: Detects the creation and execution of global flags technique using registry to launch a process after another process terminates.
data.contents: group(registry.key_path contains '\\SilentProcessExit' AND (registry.value_name contains 'MonitorProcess' OR registry.value_name contains 'ReportingMode')) OR process.parent_path ends with '\\WerFault.exe' AND (process.path ends with '\\cmd.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\powershell.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\pwsh.exe')

techniques.name: Event Triggered Execution: Image File Execution Options Injection

suppressionRules.description: This is not malicious and it is expected behavior when updating Nvidia Graphic Drivers.
suppressionRules.name: Nvidia Driver Update by NT Authority\SYSTEM

data.name: RunDLL INF Script Execution
data.description: Detects the use of RunDLL to bypass AppLocker using an INF script.
data.contents: process.path contains 'rundll32.exe' AND ((process.command_line contains 'advpack.dll' AND process.command_line contains 'LaunchINFSection' AND process.parent_command_line contains NOT '-UserConfig') OR (process.command_line contains 'setupapi.dll' AND process.command_line contains 'InstallHinfSection') OR (process.command_line contains 'ieadvpack.dll' AND process.command_line contains 'LaunchINFSection')) AND process.command_line contains '.inf'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

data.name: Uncommon INF Script Execution
data.description: Detects the uncommon use of INF script execution, which can be used to bypass AppLocker.
data.contents: (process.path contains 'cmstp.exe' OR process.path contains 'infdefaultinstall.exe') AND process.command_line contains '/s'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

data.name: Uncommon SCT Script Execution
data.description: Detects the uncommon use of SCT script execution, which can be used to bypass AppLocker.
data.contents: (process.path ends with '\\iexpress.exe' AND process.command_line contains '/n' AND process.command_line contains '.sed') OR ((process.path ends with '\\powershell.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\pwsh.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\mshta.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\regsvr32.exe') AND process.command_line contains '.sct') AND process.command_line contains NOT 'tanium.sed'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

data.name: Internal Monologue NTLM Hash Theft
data.description: Detects the modification of the RestrictSendingNTLMTraffic registry key to allow stealing NTLM hashes over the network without touching LSASS.
data.contents: registry.value_name contains 'RestrictSendingNTLMTraffic'

techniques.name: Use Alternate Authentication Material: Pass the Hash
Adversary-in-the-Middle: LLMNR/NBT-NS Poisoning and SMB Relay

data.name: Mavinject DLL Injection
data.description: Detects use of mavinject.exe to inject DLLs into a process.
data.contents: process.path contains '\\mavinject.exe' AND process.command_line contains 'INJECTRUNNING'

data.name: Uncommon RegSvcs & RegAsm Script Execution
data.description: Detects the uncommon use of RegSvcs & RegAsm script execution, which can be used to bypass AppLocker.
data.contents: process.path contains '\\Windows\\Microsoft.NET\\Framework' AND process.command_line contains '.dll' AND (process.path ends with '\\RegSvcs.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\RegAsm.exe')

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

data.name: Uncommon XSL Script Execution
data.description: Detects the uncommon use of XSL script execution, which can be used to bypass AppLocker.
data.contents: ((process.path ends with '\\msxsl.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\powershell.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\pwsh.exe') AND process.command_line contains '.xsl' AND process.command_line contains '.xml' ) OR ( process.path ends with '\\wmic.exe' AND process.command_line contains 'format:' ) AND process.parent_path ends with NOT '\\amazon-ssm-agent.exe' AND process.parent_path ends with NOT '\\ssm-document-worker.exe'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

data.name: AMSI and Script Block Evasion
data.description: Detects techniques used to bypass Anti-Malware Scan Interface (AMSI) and Script Block Logging.
data.contents: image.path contains 'System.Management.Automation' AND (process.command_line contains 'System.Management.Automation.AmsiUtils' AND (process.command_line contains 'amsiSession' OR process.command_line contains 'amsiContext' OR process.command_line contains 'amsiInitFailed')) OR (process.command_line contains 'System.Management.Automation.Utils' AND process.command_line contains 'cachedGroupPolicySettings' AND registry.key_path contains 'EnableScriptBlockLogging') OR (process.command_line contains 'System.Management.Automation.ScriptBlock' AND process.command_line contains 'signatures' AND process.command_line contains 'System.Collections.Generic.HashSet')

techniques.name: Impair Defenses: Disable or Modify Tools

data.name: Disable PowerShell Session Event Tracing
data.description: Detects disabling of the powershell session event tracing.
data.contents: process.command_line contains 'System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventProvider' AND process.command_line contains 'System.Management.Automation.Tracing.PSEtwLogProvider' AND process.command_line contains 'etwProvider'

techniques.name: Impair Defenses: Disable Windows Event Logging

data.name: Excel Web Query Execution
data.description: Detects the use of excel web query files for execution commonly used as an AppLocker bypass.
data.contents: group(file.operation is 'create' AND file.path ends with '.iqy')

data.id: Persistence using Office Templates and Trusts
data.name: Persistence using Office Templates and Trusts
data.description: Detects various office template techniques used to execute a binary via persistence. These are commonly seen in association with persisting in VDI environments.
data.contents: group(file.path contains '\\appdata\\' AND file.operation is 'create' AND (file.path ends with '.wll' OR file.path ends with '.xll' OR file.path ends with '.ppa' OR file.path ends with '.ppam')) OR (group((registry.key_path contains '\\Software\\Microsoft\\Office\\' OR registry.key_path contains '\\Software\\Microsoft\\VBA\\VBE\\') AND registry.key_path contains '\\Addins\\') AND group(file.operation is 'create' AND file.path ends with '.dll') AND process.path ends with NOT 'OfficeClickToRun.exe') OR (process.path contains 'regasm.exe' AND process.command_line contains '/codebase' AND process.command_line contains '.dll') OR (process.path contains 'VSTOInstaller.exe' AND process.command_line contains '/i' AND process.command_line contains '.vsto')

techniques.name: Office Application Startup: Office Template Macros
Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

data.name: Persistence via Certificate Store Provider
data.description: Detects usage of certificate store providers to execute a binary that can be used for persistence.
data.contents: group(registry.key_path contains 'Cryptography\\OID\\EncodingType 0\\CertDllOpenStoreProv' OR registry.key_path contains 'Microsoft\\SystemCertificates\\CA\\PhysicalStores')

suppressionRules.description: tanium gtfo
suppressionRules.name: No Tanium

data.id: Suspicious System Management Automation Image Load
data.name: Suspicious System Management Automation Image Load
data.description: Detects processes loading system.management.automation.dll (powershell) into unusual processes.
data.contents: image.path contains 'system.management.automation' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\mscorsvw.exe' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\monitoringhost.exe' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\powershell.exe' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\powershell_ise.exe' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\pwsh.exe' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\sdiagnhost.exe' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\servermanager.exe' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\sqlps.exe' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\wsmprovhost.exe' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\miiserver.exe' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\taniumclient.exe' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\taniumcx.exe' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\msiexec.exe' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\Ssms.exe' AND process.path contains NOT '\\Microsoft Visual Studio\\'

data.name: Windows Accessibility Logon Bypasses
data.description: Detects the use of logon accessibility features to bypass logon and maintain persistence.
data.contents: group( registry.key_path contains 'Microsoft\\Windows NT\\CurrentVersion\\Accessibility\\ATs' AND registry.value_name is 'StartExe' )

data.name: Diskshadow Script Execution
data.description: Detects the use of diskshadow.exe with the script flag. This can be used as an AppLocker bypass or to execute arbitrary binaries.
data.contents: process.path ends with 'diskshadow.exe' AND process.command_line contains '/s'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

data.name: Microsoft Workflow Compiler Misuse
data.description: Detects the misuse of Microsoft Workflow Compiler for injecting and executing unsigned code.
data.contents: (process.path ends with '\\Microsoft.Workflow.Compiler.exe' AND image.path contains 'System.Workflow.ComponentModel' AND (process.parent_path ends with '\\cmd.exe' OR process.parent_path ends with '\\powershell.exe' OR process.parent_path ends with '\\pwsh.exe')) OR (image.path contains 'System.Workflow.ComponentModel' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\Microsoft.Workflow.Compiler.exe' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\mscorsvw.exe' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\w3wp.exe' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\Microsoft.VisualStudio.Web.Host.exe')

techniques.name: Obfuscated Files or Information: Compile After Delivery
Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

data.name: Office Applications Executing AppData Binaries
data.description: Detects the execution of binaries by office applications in a users AppData directory which is a common staging directory.
data.contents: (process.parent_path contains 'winword.exe' OR process.parent_path contains 'excel.exe' OR process.parent_path contains 'outlook.exe' OR process.parent_path contains 'powerpnt.exe' OR process.parent_path contains 'onenote.exe' OR process.parent_path contains 'mspub.exe' OR process.parent_path contains 'msaccess.exe' OR process.parent_path contains 'lync.exe') AND (process.path contains '\\AppData') AND process.path ends with NOT '\\filecoauth.exe' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\firefox.exe' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\chrome.exe' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\OneDrive.exe' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\Teams.exe'

data.name: SharpPack Image Load
data.description: Detects the loading of SharpPack.dll into a process. SharpPack.dll can be loaded into a legitimate processes runspace to execute various malicious actions and avoids AppLocker and other whitelisting tools.
data.contents: image.path contains 'sharppack.dll'

data.name: Common Language Runtime Image Load
data.description: Detects the use of Common Language Runtime (CLR) by loading clr.dll or mscorwks.dll into uncommon processes. This is a common sign of malicious code execution in a legitimate processes runspace such as done by SharpPack.dll and other .NET reflection techniques used to avoid AppLocker and other whitelisting tools.
data.contents: (image.path ends with '\\clr.dll' OR image.path ends with '\\mscorwks.dll') AND (process.path ends with '\\winword.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\excel.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\powerpnt.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\chrome.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\firefox.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\iexplore.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\edge.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\lsass.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\explorer.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\services.exe' OR (process.path ends with '\\svchost.exe' AND process.command_line contains NOT '-k localsystemnetworkrestricted'))

data.name: ProcDump Execution
data.description: Detects the execution of the tool ProcDump used for capturing the contents of a processes memory into a file. This is commonly used by attackers to image lsass memory that contains credentials as well as other processes memory that contains sensitive data of value.
data.contents: registry.key_path contains 'Sysinternals\\ProcDump' AND process.command_line contains 'accepteula'

data.name: Suspicious NTDSUtil Execution
data.description: Detects the use of NTDSUtil to create a full backup of the ntds.dit file which along with the acquisition of the SYSTEM and SECURITY hives can be used to extract the password hashes offline.
data.contents: process.path contains 'ntdsutil' AND ((process.command_line contains 'ntds' AND (process.command_line contains 'activate' OR process.command_line contains 'ac') AND (process.command_line contains 'instance' OR process.command_line contains 'in') AND (process.command_line contains 'create' OR process.command_line contains 'cr') AND (process.command_line contains 'full' OR process.command_line contains 'fu')) OR group(file.operation is 'create' AND file.path contains 'ntds.dit'))

data.name: Putty Spawning Suspicious Children
data.description: This signal looks for common putty processes spawning child processes that are not putty.exe
data.contents: (process.parent_path ends with '\\putty.exe' OR process.parent_path ends with '\\pscp.exe' OR process.parent_path ends with '\\psftp.exe' OR process.parent_path ends with '\\puttytel.exe' OR (process.parent_path ends with '\\plink.exe' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\conhost.exe')) AND process.path ends with NOT '\\putty.exe'

data.id: Binary Created by C# Command Line Compiler
data.name: Binary Created by C# Command Line Compiler
data.description: Detects the use of C# Command-Line Compiler (csc.exe) to compile a binary or library on a system. This can be used by attackers to create a binary in memory when wrapped in a cradle or to compile attacker binaries on disk before execution.
data.contents: process.path ends with '\\csc.exe' AND process.command_line contains 'nologo' AND process.command_line contains 'target'

techniques.name: Obfuscated Files or Information: Compile After Delivery
Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

data.id: Browser Created HTA or PS1 Files
data.name: Browser Created HTA or PS1 Files
data.description: Detects the creation of HTA or powershell script files that are commonly created when visiting malicious domains.
data.contents: (process.path ends with 'iexplore.exe' OR process.path ends with 'firefox.exe' OR process.path ends with 'browser_broker.exe' OR process.path ends with 'chrome.exe') AND group((file.operation is 'create' OR file.operation is 'rename') AND (file.path ends with '.hta' OR file.path ends with '.ps1') AND file.path contains NOT '\\windows\\temp\\__PSScriptPolicy')

data.name: Bypass User Account Control
data.description: The user account control (UAC) requires user interaction to escalate a process to a higher privilege, using bypasses such as sdclt.exe an attacker can escalate his processes privilege on a system.
data.contents: (process.path ends with 'sdclt.exe' AND process.command_line contains 'kickoff') OR (((process.path ends with '\\reg.exe' AND process.command_line contains 'add') OR (process.command_line contains 'new-item' AND process.command_line contains 'set-item')) AND process.command_line contains '\\cmd.exe')

techniques.name: Abuse Elevation Control Mechanism: Bypass User Account Control
Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

data.name: Control Panel Items
data.description: Control panel items can be used to execute arbitrary code and is a well known bypass mechanism for red teams and attackers.
data.contents: (process.path ends with '\\rundll32.exe' AND process.command_line contains 'Control' AND process.command_line contains 'RunDLL') OR (file.path ends with '.cpl' AND (registry.key_path contains 'CurrentVersion\\Control Panel\\' OR registry.key_path contains '\\ControlPanel\\' OR registry.key_path contains '\\Control Folder\\') AND process.path ends with NOT 'OfficeClickToRun.exe')

techniques.name: Signed Binary Proxy Execution: Control Panel
Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

data.name: Indirect Command Execution
data.description: Indirect command execution is used by attackers to execute binaries without calling them directly or from a command prompt. This is a common method of evading detection.
data.contents: (process.path ends with '\\forfiles.exe' AND process.command_line contains '/c') OR (process.path ends with '\\pcalua.exe' AND process.command_line contains '-a') OR (process.path ends with '\\AtBroker.exe' AND process.command_line contains '/start') OR (process.path ends with '\\bash.exe' AND process.command_line contains '-c')

techniques.name: Signed Binary Proxy Execution: Control Panel
Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

data.name: Kerberoasting
data.description: Typically only lsass will deal with kerberos over the network and use port 88. If processes other than lsass are found to be using port 88 this could be related to suspicious kerberos activity such as kerberoasting.
data.contents: network.port is 88 AND process.path ends with NOT '\\lsass.exe' AND process.path ends with NOT 'system' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\nmap.exe'

techniques.name: Steal or Forge Kerberos Tickets: Kerberoasting

data.name: MSBuild Remote Execution
data.description: Running msbuild with a remote hosted file can be used by attackers to download and execute malicious code while bypassing security controls on systems.
data.contents: process.path contains 'msbuild' AND process.command_line contains 'ScriptFile' AND process.command_line contains 'http'

techniques.name: Trusted Developer Utilities Proxy Execution: MSBuild
Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

suppressionRules.description: InSync
suppressionRules.name: InSync

data.name: MSIExec Remote Execution
data.description: Running msiexec with a remote hosted file can be used by attackers to download and execute malicious code while bypassing security controls on systems.
data.contents: process.path ends with '\\msiexec.exe' AND (process.command_line contains '/quiet' OR process.command_line contains '/q') AND process.command_line contains '/i' AND (process.command_line contains 'http:' OR process.command_line contains 'https:' OR process.command_line contains 'ftp:')

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

data.name: Trusted Developer Utilities Proxy Execution
data.description: There are several methods of compiling or executing code that are normally only executed by developers or build systems but also can be used by attackers to evade detection and gain execution.
data.contents: (process.path ends with '\\MSBuild.exe' AND (process.command_line contains '.xml' OR process.command_line contains '.csproj')) OR (process.path ends with '\\tracker.exe' AND process.command_line contains '/d') OR ((process.path ends with '\\rcsi.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\csi.exe') AND process.command_line contains '.csx') OR (process.path ends with '\\cdb.exe' AND process.command_line contains '-o') OR process.path ends with '\\dnx.exe'

techniques.name: Trusted Developer Utilities Proxy Execution: MSBuild
Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

data.name: WMI Managed Object Format Execution
data.description: Windows managed object format can be used to create common information model classes which are compiled with mofcomp.exe. Attackers can use MOF files to configure backdoor persistence on systems.
data.contents: process.path ends with '\\mofcomp.exe' AND process.command_line contains '.mof' AND process.parent_path ends with NOT 'MsMpEng.exe' AND process.command_line contains NOT '\\Windows Defender\\'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

data.name: Kekeo Command Arguments
data.description: Detects command line arguments commonly supplied to the Kekeo credential theft utility.
data.contents: process.command_line contains 'tgt::' OR process.command_line contains 'tgs::' OR process.command_line contains 'exploit::' OR process.command_line contains 'misc::' OR process.command_line contains 'kerberos::' OR process.command_line contains 'smb::' OR process.command_line contains 'ntlm::' OR process.command_line contains 'tsssp::'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

data.name: Suspicious VBScript Execution
data.description: Detects usage of the RUNDLL32.EXE or MSHTA.EXE utilities to execute VBScript. Often used by fileless malware to dynamically pass and execute code at runtime.
data.contents: (process.path ends with 'rundll32.exe' OR process.path ends with 'mshta.exe') AND process.command_line contains 'vbscript:'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell
Command and Scripting Interpreter: Visual Basic

data.name: Minifilter Driver Enumeration
data.description: Adversaries can use fltmc.exe to enumerate loaded drivers and see their assigned altitude numbers for determining which security tools are running.
data.contents: process.path ends with 'fltmc.exe' OR process.command_line contains 'misc::mflt'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

data.name: Nltest Execution
data.description: Nltest can be used by an attacker as a means to retrieve the NetNTLM Hash.
data.contents: process.path ends with 'nltest.exe' AND process.command_line contains '/server:' AND process.command_line contains '/query'

data.name: Right-to-Left Override
data.description: Detects the use of Right-to-Left Override to reverse characters in a filename. This is commonly used to disguise files by hiding their true extension.
data.contents: process.path contains '\xe2\x80\xae' OR process.command_line contains '\xe2\x80\xae' OR file.path contains '\xe2\x80\xae'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

data.name: Windows Remote Shell Command Execution
data.description: Detects the use of Windows Remote Shell on a host.
data.contents: process.parent_path ends with '\\winrshost.exe' AND process.path ends with '\\cmd.exe'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

suppressionRules.description: Remove gotomeeting temp instalers
suppressionRules.name: GoToMeeting

suppressionRules.name: Ignore System User

data.contents:
(file.operation is 'create'
OR
file.operation is 'rename'
)
AND
(
	file.path starts with 'C:\\Windows\\system32\\microsoft\\crypto\\rsa\\machinekeys'
	OR
	file.path starts with 'C:\\Windows\\system32\\taskes_migrated\\microsoft\\windows\\pla\\system'
	OR
	file.path starts with 'C:\\Windows\\syswow64\\tasks\\microsoft\\windows\\pla\\system'
	OR
	file.path starts with 'C:\\Windows\\debug\\wia'
	OR
	file.path starts with 'C:\\Windows\\system32\\tasks'
	OR
	file.path starts with 'C:\\Windows\\syswow64\\tasks'
	OR
	file.path starts with 'C:\\Windows\\tasks'
	OR
	file.path starts with 'C:\\Windows\\registration\\crmlog'
	OR
	file.path starts with 'C:\\Windows\\system32\\com\\dmp'
	OR
	file.path starts with 'C:\\Windows\\system32\\fxstmp'
	OR
	file.path starts with 'C:\\Windows\\system32\\spool\\drivers\\color'
	OR
	file.path starts with 'C:\\Windows\\system32\\spool\\servers'

data.name: Nltest Discovery
data.description: Nltest can be used by an attacker to discover details of an environments domains, trusts, systems, and configurations.
data.contents: process.path ends with '\\nltest.exe' AND (process.command_line contains 'domain_trusts' OR process.command_line contains 'dclist' OR process.command_line contains 'dsgetdc' OR process.command_line contains 'parentdomain')

data.name: Non Break Space Character
data.description: Detects the use of a non break space characters in a filename or command line. This can be used to make files appear to be named or in the same directory as legitimate files.
data.contents: process.path contains '\xc2\xa0' OR process.command_line contains '\xc2\xa0' OR file.path contains '\xc2\xa0'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

data.name: Base64 Commands Exfil
data.description: Detects common commands used to exfiltrate data encoded with base64 over TCP.
data.contents: process.path ends with 'ssh' AND process.command_line contains 'ssh' AND process.command_line contains 'base64' AND process.command_line contains '>' AND file.path ends with 'tty'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Unix Shell

data.name: GDB Commands Reverse Shell
data.description: Detects common commands used to create a reverse shell with GDB.
data.contents: process.path ends with 'gdb' AND process.command_line contains 'python' AND process.command_line contains 'import' AND process.command_line contains 'socket' AND process.command_line contains 'pty' AND process.command_line contains 'connect' AND process.command_line contains 'getenv' AND process.command_line contains 'dup2' AND process.command_line contains 'fileno' AND process.command_line contains 'spawn' AND process.command_line contains 'sh'

data.name: Java Reverse Shell Commands
data.description: Detects common commands used to create a reverse shell with java.
data.contents: process.path ends with 'java' AND process.command_line contains 'sh' AND process.command_line contains '-c' AND process.command_line contains 'exec' AND process.command_line contains 'dev' AND process.command_line contains 'cat' AND process.command_line contains 'while' AND process.command_line contains 'read' AND process.command_line contains 'line' AND process.command_line contains 'String' AND process.command_line contains 'waitFor'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Unix Shell

data.name: Node Commands Bind Shell
data.description: Detects common commands used to create a bind shell with node.
data.contents: process.command_line contains 'node' AND process.command_line contains '-e' AND process.command_line contains '=' AND process.command_line contains 'child_process' AND process.command_line contains 'spawn' AND process.command_line contains 'createServer' AND process.command_line contains 'client.pipe' AND process.command_line contains 'sh.stdin' AND process.command_line contains 'sh.stderr' AND process.command_line contains 'listen' AND process.command_line contains 'process.env'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Unix Shell

data.name: Node Commands Reverse Shell
data.description: Detects common commands used to create a reverse shell with node.
data.contents: process.command_line contains 'node' AND process.command_line contains '-e' AND process.command_line contains '=' AND process.command_line contains 'child_process' AND process.command_line contains 'spawn' AND process.command_line contains 'net.connect' AND process.command_line contains 'process.env' AND process.command_line contains 'function' AND process.command_line contains 'this.pipe' AND process.command_line contains 'sh.stdout' AND process.command_line contains 'sh.stderr'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Unix Shell

data.name: OpenSSL Commands Reverse Shell
data.description: Detects common commands used to create a reverse shell with OpenSSL.
data.contents: process.path ends with 'openssl' AND process.command_line contains 's_client' AND process.command_line contains 'quiet' AND process.command_line contains 'connect'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Unix Shell

suppressionRules.description: /usr/bin/chmod
suppressionRules.name: chmod

data.name: PHP Commands Reverse Shell
data.description: Detects common commands used to create a reverse shell with php.
data.contents: process.command_line contains 'php' AND process.command_line contains '-r' AND process.command_line contains 'fsockopen' AND process.command_line contains 'exec' AND process.command_line contains 'sh'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Unix Shell

data.name: Perl CPAN Commands Reverse Shell
data.description: Detects common commands used to create a reverse shell with perl.
data.contents: process.path ends with 'perl' AND process.command_line contains 'cpan' AND file.path contains 'tty' AND file.path contains '.cpan' AND process.parent_path ends with 'sh'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Unix Shell

data.name: Perl Commands Reverse Shell
data.description: Detects common commands used to create a reverse shell with perl.

data.name: Python Commands Download
data.description: Detects the use of python to download potentially suspect content.
data.contents: process.command_line contains 'python' AND process.command_line contains '-c' AND process.command_line contains 'import' AND process.command_line contains 'os' AND process.command_line contains 'environ' AND process.command_line contains 'sys.version_info.major' AND process.command_line contains 'urllib' AND process.command_line contains 'urlretrieve'

data.name: Python Commands Exfil
data.description: Detects the potential use of python to exfiltrate data.
data.contents: process.command_line contains 'python' AND process.command_line contains '-c' AND process.command_line contains 'import' AND process.command_line contains 'os' AND process.command_line contains 'sys.version_info.major' AND ( ( process.command_line contains 'urllib' AND process.command_line contains 'urlopen' AND process.command_line contains 'bytes' AND process.command_line contains 'urlencode' AND process.command_line contains 'read' ) OR ( process.command_line contains 'http.server' AND process.command_line contains 'socketserver' AND process.command_line contains 'SimpleHTTPServer' AND process.command_line contains 'TCPServer' AND process.command_line contains 'SimpleHTTPRequestHandler' AND process.command_line contains 'serve_forever' ) )

data.name: Python Commands Reverse Shell

data.name: Ruby Commands Reverse Shell
data.description: Detects common commands used to create a reverse shell with ruby.
data.contents: process.command_line contains 'ruby' AND process.command_line contains '-rsocket' AND process.command_line contains 'TCPSocket' AND process.command_line contains 'sh'

data.name: Socat Commands Bind Shell

data.name: TCPDump Commands Privilege Escalation

data.name: Domain Account Enumeration
data.description: Detects usage of the NET.EXE utility to enumerate domain users. Often used during post-compromise reconnaissance.
data.contents: (process.path ends with '\\net.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\net1.exe') AND process.command_line contains 'user' AND process.command_line contains '/Domain' AND process.parent_command_line contains NOT 'windows\\ccmcache' AND process.parent_path contains NOT 'windows\\ccmcache' AND process.parent_command_line contains NOT '\\SupportAssist' AND process.parent_path contains NOT 'SupportAssist'

data.contents: process.path ends with '\\register-cimprovider.exe' AND process.command_line contains 'path'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

data.name: Folder Permission Enumeration
data.description: Monitors for commands used to enumerate files with weak permissions. Files with weak permissions can some times be used for privilege escalation or persistence.
data.contents: process.command_line contains 'find' AND process.command_line contains '-perm' AND (process.command_line contains '-002' OR process.command_line contains '-0+w' OR process.command_line contains '777' OR process.command_line contains '-a=w' OR process.command_line contains '4000' OR process.command_line contains '2000' OR process.command_line contains '6000')

Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

data.name: Conhost Spawned Executable
data.description: Enables Conhost to be able to run from the command line followed by an executable, which spawns it as a child process. Attackers can use this feature to perform indirect execution to evade some detection mechanisms.
data.contents: process.parent_path ends with '\\conhost.exe'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

data.name: Disable Tanium ETW

techniques.name: Impair Defenses: Disable or Modify Tools

data.name: Disable Windows Defender
data.description: Detects the modification of the Windows Defender DisableAntiSpyware setting in the registry.
data.contents: group(registry.key_path contains '\\SOFTWARE\\Policies\\Microsoft\\Windows Defender' AND registry.value_name contains 'DisableAntiSpyware') AND process.path ends with NOT '\\svchost.exe'

techniques.name: Impair Defenses: Disable or Modify Tools

data.name: Explorer Spawned Executable
data.description: Enables Explorer to be run from the command line followed by an executable, which spawns it as a child process. Attackers can use this feature to perform indirect execution to evade some detection mechanisms.
data.contents: process.path ends with '\\explorer.exe' AND process.command_line contains '/factory' AND process.command_line contains '-Embedding' AND process.parent_path is '<Unknown Process>'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

data.name: Extract Keychain Credentials
data.description: Detects the use of dump-keychain which is used to extract Keychain Credentials.
data.contents: process.command_line contains 'sudo' AND process.command_line contains 'security' AND process.command_line contains 'dump-keychain' AND process.command_line contains 'login.keychain'

data.name: File Download with Desktopimgdownldr
data.description: Detects the use of desktopimgdownldr.exe to download a file.
data.contents: process.path ends with '\\desktopimgdownldr.exe' AND process.command_line contains 'lockscreenurl'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

data.name: Netsh Port Forwarding
data.description: Detects the use of netsh.exe used for port forwarding. This can allow attackers to tunnel interactions on jump boxes.
data.contents: process.path ends with '\\netsh.exe' AND process.command_line contains 'l=' AND process.command_line contains 'listena' AND process.command_line contains 'connectp' AND process.command_line contains 'c='

data.name: Pktmon Full Packet Capture
data.description: Enables Pktmon to be used to get a full packet capture on a host with the -p 0 setting when starting the capture. This can be used by attackers to monitor for passwords or other data of interest being transmitted over the wire.
data.contents: process.path ends with '\\pktmon.exe' AND process.command_line contains 'start' AND process.command_line contains 'etw' AND process.command_line contains 'p' AND process.command_line contains '0'

data.name: RunDll Creating MiniDump Function 24
data.description: Detects the execution of RunDll32 to create a process minidump by invoking comsvcs.dll function 24. This can be used by attackers to image lsass memory that contains credentials as well as other processes memory that contains sensitive data of value.
data.contents: process.path ends with '\\rundll32.exe' AND process.command_line contains 'comsvcs.dll' AND process.command_line contains '24'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

data.name: Security Trampoline Privilege Escalation
data.description: The MacOS AuthorizationExecuteWithPrivileges API is a method for applications to request root privileges. This API is deprecated by Apple and has a number of security vulnerabilities. The use of this API is suspicious, but not necessarily malicious.
data.contents: process.path contains 'security_authtrampoline'

techniques.name: Abuse Elevation Control Mechanism: Setuid and Setgid

data.name: Suspicious PowerShell Command Line Encodeda

data.contents: (process.path ends with '\\powershell.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\pwsh.exe') AND process.command_line contains 'encodeda'

data.name: RDP Tunneling with Chisel
data.description: Chisel is a network tunneling tool that can be used to create encrypted channels into internal network environments, such as to perform RDP tunnelling. Chisel can transmit TCP over HTTP and encrypt the communication via SSH in order to evade firewall rules and deep packet inspection.
data.contents: process.command_line contains 'client' AND process.command_line contains 'R:' AND process.command_line contains ':3389'

data.id: RDP Tunneling with Fast Reverse Proxy
data.name: RDP Tunneling with Fast Reverse Proxy
data.description: Fast Reverse Proxy (FRP) is a networking tool that can be used to expose firewalled or NAT’d network IPs to the Internet. It supports TCP and UDP, as well as HTTP and HTTPS protocols.
data.contents: process.path ends with '\\frpc.exe' AND process.command_line contains '-c' AND process.command_line contains '.ini' AND network.port is '3389'

data.name: RDP Tunneling with plink
data.description: A common utility used to tunnel RDP sessions is PuTTY Link, commonly known as Plink. Plink can be used to establish SSH network connections to other systems using arbitrary source and destination ports. Since many IT environments either do not perform protocol inspection or do not block SSH communications outbound from their network, attackers such as FIN8 have used Plink to create encrypted tunnels that allow RDP ports on infected systems to communicate back to the attacker command and control (C2) server.
data.contents: process.path ends with '\\plink.exe' AND process.command_line contains '-P' AND process.command_line contains '-T' AND process.command_line contains '-N' AND process.command_line contains '-C' AND process.command_line contains '-R' AND process.command_line contains ':3389'

data.name: UMWorkerProcess Spawned Processes
data.description: This detects processes that are spawned by the UMWorkerProcess.  The UMWorkerProcess does not typically spawn child processes and may be a sign of process injection.
data.contents: process.ancestry_path ends with '\\UMWorkerProcess.exe' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\werfault.exe' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\wermgr.exe'

data.name: Unsigned Process Creating a Binary
data.description: Detects an unsigned process creating a binary on disk, which may be a sign of attack activity.
data.contents: process.signature_status is 'no_signature' AND group(file.operation is 'create' AND file.path ends with '.exe') AND (process.ancestry_path ends with NOT '\\TaniumModuleServer.exe' OR process.path contains NOT '\\Tanium Module Server\\')

data.name: Unsigned Process Creating a Driver
data.description: Detects an unsigned process creating a driver on disk, which may be a sign of attack activity.
data.contents: process.signature_status is 'no_signature' AND group(file.operation is 'create' AND file.path ends with '.sys')

data.name: Unsigned Process Creating a Library
data.description: Detects an unsigned process creating a dynamic-link library on disk, which may be a sign of attack activity.
data.contents: process.signature_status is 'no_signature' AND group(file.operation is 'create' AND file.path ends with '.dll')

data.id: Unsigned Process Creating a PowerShell Script
data.name: Unsigned Process Creating a PowerShell Script
data.description: Detects an unsigned process creating a PowerShell script file, which may be a sign of attack activity.
data.contents: process.signature_status is 'no_signature' AND group(file.operation is 'create' AND file.path ends with '.ps1')

data.id: Unsigned Process Modifying Files in Windows Directory
data.name: Unsigned Process Modifying Files in Windows Directory
data.description: Detects an unsigned processes modifying files in the windows system directory, which may be a sign of attack activity.
data.contents: process.signature_status is 'no_signature' AND file.path contains ':\\windows\\'

data.name: Wininit Running as not System
data.description: Detects when wininit.exe is running as something other than the system user, which could indicate attacker activity.
data.contents: process.path ends with '\\wininit.exe' AND process.user_name is NOT 'SYSTEM'

techniques.name: Masquerading: Match Legitimate Name or Location

data.contents: process.ancestry_path ends with '\\winword.exe' AND process.path ends with NOT '\\winword.exe' AND network.port is '443'

data.name: Bcdedit Boot into Safe Mode
data.description: Detects usage of bcdedit.exe to force the computer to boot into safemode during the next boot. This has been seen used by ransomware as a technique to avoid security software preventions.
data.contents: process.path ends with '\\bcdedit.exe' AND process.command_line contains 'set' AND process.command_line contains 'current' AND process.command_line contains 'safeboot'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

data.name: BootCFG Boot into Safe Mode

data.name: Command Processor AutoRun Persistence
data.description: Detects when a AutoRun key for the command processor is set which can be used by attackers for persistence when the /D flag is not added to a command.
data.contents: registry.key_path contains '\\Software\\Microsoft\\Command Processor\\AutoRun'

data.name: Python SimpleHTTPRequestHandler Exfil
data.description: Detects the potential use of python SimpleHTTPRequestHandler for data exfiltration.
data.contents: process.path contains '/python' AND process.command_line contains 'import' AND process.command_line contains 'http.server.SimpleHTTPRequestHandler' AND process.command_line contains 'socketserver.TCPServer' AND process.command_line contains 'serve_forever'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Unix Shell

data.name: SUID or GUID Enumeration
data.description: Detects commands used to enumerate files with the SUID or GUID bits configured. Attackers may search for files with setsuid or setgid bits in order to execute programs in a different user context, which could provide privilege escalation or persistence.
data.contents: process.command_line contains 'find' AND process.command_line contains '-perm' AND (process.command_line contains '4000' OR process.command_line contains '2000' OR process.command_line contains '6000' OR process.command_line contains 'u=s' OR process.command_line contains 'u+s' OR process.command_line contains 'g=s' OR process.command_line contains 'g+s' OR process.command_line contains 'a+s' OR process.command_line contains 'a=s')

techniques.name: Hijack Execution Flow: Executable Installer File Permissions Weakness
Abuse Elevation Control Mechanism: Setuid and Setgid

data.name: Service Security Descriptor Discovery SCManager
data.description: Detects usage of the sc.exe utility to enumerate security descriptors of scmanager. Attackers can use this during post-compromise reconnaissance of DACL permissions to enumerate the scmanager binary.
data.contents: process.path ends with '\\sc.exe' AND process.command_line contains 'sdshow' AND process.command_line contains 'scmanager'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

data.name: Service Security Descriptor Persistence SCManager
data.description: Detects usage of the sc.exe utility to set the security descriptors of scmanager. Attackers can use this during post-compromise to set the DACL permissions for the scmanager binary which can be used for persistence.
data.contents: process.path ends with '\\sc.exe' AND process.command_line contains 'sdset' AND process.command_line contains 'scmanager'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

data.name: Persistence via Office Application Startup
data.description: The Microsoft Office "Office Test" Registry Key may be leveraged by adversaries to load a DLL during launch of an Office Application.
data.contents: registry.key_path contains 'Software\\Microsoft\\Office test\\Special\\Perf'

data.name: RDP Enabled via Registry Modification
data.description: Detects the enablement of RDP on a system via modification of the property values of the fDenyTSConnections and UserAuthentication keys.
data.contents: registry.key_path contains '\\Control\\Terminal Server\\WinStations\\Rdp-Tcp' OR group(registry.key_path contains '\\Control\\Terminal Server' AND registry.value_name contains 'fDenyTSConnections')

data.name: Windows Telemetry Control Monitoring
data.description: The Telemetry Control monitoring subsystem in Windows is designed to be extensible via the registry.  By registering a new subkey of HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\AppCompatFlags\TelemetryController it executes any command line put in the command value.
data.contents: group(registry.key_path contains '\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Windows NT\\CurrentVersion\\AppCompatFlags\\TelemetryController' AND registry.value_name is 'Command')

data.name: Non-Microsoft Signed Print Spooler Driver
data.description: Detects a non-Microsoft signed print spooler driver being loaded. This is an indicator of the PrintNightmare vulnerability being used.
data.contents: group(image.signature_issuer contains NOT 'Microsoft' AND image.path contains '\\Windows\\System32\\spool\\drivers\\') AND process.path ends with '\\spoolsv.exe'

data.id: Non-Ssms Spawned SQL Client Tools PowerShell Session
data.name: Non-Ssms Spawned SQL Client Tools PowerShell Session
data.description: Detects the potential misuse of a SQL client tools PowerShell session where smss is not the parent. This is a known attacker living off the land technique.
data.contents: process.path ends with 'ps.exe' AND process.path contains '\\sql' AND process.parent_path ends with NOT '\\ssms.exe'

data.name: Remote Proxy Execution
data.description: Detects the use of the Windows Debugging packaged tool remote.exe to spawn a child process.
data.contents: process.path ends with '\\remote.exe' AND process.command_line contains 's'

data.name: GoDaddy Administrator Account Enumeration
data.description: Detects usage of the NET.EXE or DSQuery.exe utility to enumerate members of the local Administrators or Domain Administrators groups. Often used during post-compromise reconnaissance.
data.contents: (((process.command_line contains 'group' AND process.command_line contains 'Domain' AND process.command_line contains 'Admins') OR (process.command_line contains 'localgroup' AND process.command_line contains 'Administrators') OR (process.command_line contains 'Exchange' AND process.command_line contains 'Trusted' AND process.command_line contains 'Subsystem')) AND process.path ends with '\\net.exe' AND process.parent_command_line contains NOT 'windows\\ccmcache' AND process.parent_path contains NOT 'windows\\ccmcache' AND process.parent_command_line contains NOT '\\SupportAssist' AND process.parent_path contains NOT 'SupportAssist' AND process.command_line contains NOT '/add') OR (process.command_line contains 'Admin' AND process.path ends with '\\dsquery.exe')

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

data.name: GoDaddy BITSADMIN File Retrieval and Execution
data.description: The Background Intelligent Transfer Service (BITS) is a built-in Windows utility that can be used to download and execute files, as well as upload files, to a URL. Direct execution of the BITSADMIN utility is uncommon, and may be abused to retrieve and run malware or transfer other files. Recurrent BITS jobs can also be used as a persistence mechanism.
data.contents: process.path ends with '\\bitsadmin.exe' AND ((process.command_line contains 'http' AND (process.command_line contains '/AddFile' OR process.command_line contains '/transfer')) OR ((process.command_line contains '/SetNotifyCmdLine' AND process.command_line contains '/AddFile') OR process.command_line contains '/setproxysettings')) AND process.command_line contains NOT '\\DSS'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

data.name: GoDaddy China Chopper Command Line Usage v2
data.description: Custom created signal
data.contents: process.command_line contains  '&cd&echo'

data.name: GoDaddy Command Shell Launched by Office Applications
data.description: Detects the execution of PowerShell or native command prompt by an Office application. May indicate document-based attacks.
data.contents: (process.parent_path ends with '\\winword.exe' OR process.parent_path ends with '\\excel.exe' OR process.parent_path ends with '\\outlook.exe' OR process.parent_path ends with '\\powerpnt.exe' OR process.parent_path ends with '\\onenote.exe' OR process.parent_path ends with '\\mspub.exe' OR process.parent_path ends with '\\msaccess.exe' OR process.parent_path ends with '\\lync.exe') AND (process.path ends with '\\cmd.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\powershell.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\pwsh.exe')

data.description: Detects the creation and execution of global flags technique using registry to launch a process after another process terminates.

data.description: Detects command line arguments commonly supplied to the Mimikatz credential theft utility when executed in non-interactive mode.

data.name: GoDaddy Windows Event Logs Cleared
data.description: Detects use of command line utilities to clear the Windows event logs.
data.contents: (process.path ends with '\\wevtutil.exe' AND process.command_line contains ' cl ') OR (process.path ends with '\\wmic.exe' AND process.command_line contains 'cleareventlog') OR ((process.path ends with '\\powershell.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\pwsh.exe') AND (process.command_line contains 'Clear-EventLog' OR process.command_line contains 'Remove-EventLog'))

data.name: GoDaddy WMIC Process Creation
data.description: Detects usage of the WMIC.EXE command line utility to create a process. Often used for remote process execution or to disguise a locally-executed process' ancestry.
data.contents: process.path ends with 'wmic.exe' AND process.command_line contains 'process' AND process.command_line contains 'call' AND process.command_line contains 'create' AND process.parent_path contains NOT 'TaniumClientDeploy'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

data.name: GoDaddy Volume Shadow Copy Deletion
data.description: Detects usage of the VSSADMIN.EXE or WMIC.EXE utilities to delete Volume Shadow Copies. Often used by ransomware to eliminate backed-up data, as well as by targeted attackers seeking to destroy evidence of prior activity.
data.contents: (process.path ends with 'wmic.exe' OR process.path ends with 'vssadmin.exe') AND process.command_line contains 'delete' AND process.command_line contains 'shadow'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

data.name: GoDaddy User Added to Local Administrators
data.description: Detects usage of NET.EXE to add an account to the local Administrator users group.
data.contents: (process.path ends with '\\net.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\net1.exe') AND process.command_line contains 'localgroup administrators' AND process.command_line contains '/add' AND process.parent_command_line contains NOT 'windows\\ccmcache' AND process.parent_path contains NOT 'windows\\ccmcache' AND process.parent_command_line contains NOT '\\SupportAssist' AND process.parent_path contains NOT 'SupportAssist'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

data.name: GoDaddy Uncommon SCT Script Execution
data.description: Detects the uncommon use of SCT script execution, which can be used to bypass AppLocker.
data.contents: (process.path ends with '\\iexpress.exe' AND process.command_line contains '/n' AND process.command_line contains '.sed') OR ((process.path ends with '\\powershell.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\pwsh.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\mshta.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\regsvr32.exe') AND process.command_line contains '.sct') AND process.command_line contains NOT 'tanium.sed'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

data.name: GoDaddy Uncommon INF Script Execution
data.description: Detects the uncommon use of INF script execution, which can be used to bypass AppLocker.
data.contents: (process.path contains 'cmstp.exe' OR process.path contains 'infdefaultinstall.exe') AND process.command_line contains '/s'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

data.name: GoDaddy Suspicious PowerShell Process Ancestry
data.description: Detects execution of the PowerShell script interpreter by atypical parent processes. Office macro malware attacks often employ this technique. The signal looks for PowerShell spawned by the CSCRIPT.EXE, WSCRIPT.EXE, or MSHTA.EXE interpreters, as well as by the Microsoft Word or Excel applications, to cover both direct and indirect execution.
data.contents: (process.path ends with '\\powershell.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\pwsh.exe') AND (process.parent_path ends with '\\wscript.exe' OR process.parent_path ends with '\\cscript.exe' OR process.parent_path ends with '\\mshta.exe' OR process.parent_path ends with '\\winword.exe' OR process.parent_path ends with '\\excel.exe') AND process.parent_command_line contains NOT 'AnyConnect' AND process.command_line contains NOT '\\Tanium\\Tanium Client\\Downloads\\Action' AND process.parent_command_line contains NOT '\\Tanium\\Tanium Client\\Patch\\'

data.name: Certoc DLL Load
data.description: Certoc can be used by attackers to load a dll while bypassing security controls on systems. Using certoc.exe the dll is loaded via the LoadDLL flag.
data.contents: process.path ends with '\\certoc.exe' AND process.command_line contains 'LoadDLL'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

data.name: Cmdl32 Remote File Download
data.description: Detects use of the Windows native utility cmdl32.exe to download a file. This is a known attacker living off the land technique.
data.contents: process.path ends with '\\cmdl32.exe' AND process.command_line contains 'vpn' AND process.command_line contains 'lan'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

data.name: Disable Defender Real Time Protection
data.description: Detects the modification of the Windows Defender Real Time setting in the registry. This disables Defender real-time protection.
data.contents: group(registry.key_path contains '\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Windows Defender\\Real-Time Protection' AND registry.value_name contains 'DisableRealtimeMonitoring')

techniques.name: Impair Defenses: Disable or Modify Tools

data.name: Downloaded Files Database Activity
data.description: This Signal detects the sqlite3 utility being used to interact with the macOS QuarantineEvents database which contains metadata of apps downloading files from the Internet. Malware may use this DB to search for itself or search for related metadata.
data.contents: process.path ends with 'sqlite3' and process.command_line contains 'com.apple.LaunchServices.QuarantineEventsV' and process.parent_path ends with NOT 'firefox'

data.name: Esentutl Accessing Webcache
data.description: Detects Esentutl executing with webcache in its command line. This activity has been seen used to copy webcache by cobalt strike and other malware.
data.contents: process.path ends with '\\esentutl.exe' AND process.command_line contains 'webcache'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

data.name: Ifcfg Enable Promiscuous Mode
data.description: Enables promiscuous mode with ifcfg on a network interface. This can be used by attackers to monitor for passwords or other data of interest being transmitted over the wire.
data.contents: process.command_line contains 'ifcfg' AND process.command_line contains 'promisc'

data.name: Imewdbld File Download
data.description: Detects the potential use of imewdbld.exe to download data, which is a known living off the land attacker technique.
data.contents: process.path ends with '\\imewdbld.exe' AND process.command_line contains 'http'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

data.name: Lsass Process Dump Creation
data.description: Detects the creation of an lsass.exe processes memory dump. This can be a sign of attackers dumping lsass memory that contains credentials for offline analysis.
data.contents: process.path ends with '\\werfault.exe' AND group(file.path contains 'lsass.exe' AND file.path contains 'dmp')

data.name: RDP Tunneling Ngrok
data.description: Detects use of ngrok to listen for RDP connections on the internet. This technique can be used by attackers to bypasses network restrictions by tunneling malicious connections.
data.contents: process.command_line contains '3389' AND network.dns_query contains 'ngrok' AND network.port is '3389'

data.name: Setupcl Creation Defender Bypass
data.description: Detects the creation of an executable named setupcl.exe which is ignored by Defender.
data.contents: group(file.path ends with '\\setupcl.cs' AND file.operation is 'create')

techniques.name: Masquerading: Match Legitimate Name or Location
Obfuscated Files or Information: Compile After Delivery

data.name: GoDaddy REGSVR32 Script Component Runtime Misuse
data.description: Detects the use of regsvr32 to download content from a malicious URL and invoke the Microsoft Script Component Runtime (scrobj.dll) module to execute the code.
data.contents: process.path ends with 'regsvr32.exe' AND (((process.command_line contains 'http:' OR process.command_line contains 'https:') AND process.command_line contains 'scrobj') OR (process.command_line contains 'i:' AND process.command_line contains 'rs64'))

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

data.name: GoDaddy Remote Scheduled Task Creation
data.description: Detects the use of AT.EXE or SCHTASKS.EXE to create a scheduled task on a remote computer. Attackers commonly use this technique to execute a command on a remote system during lateral movement.
data.contents: (process.path ends with 'schtasks.exe' AND process.command_line contains '/create' AND process.command_line contains '/s ') OR (process.path ends with '\\at.exe' AND process.command_line contains '\\\\')

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

data.name: GoDaddy Remote Service Creation
data.description: Detects the creation of a Windows service on a remote host using the SC.EXE command. May be used by attackers to establish persistence for a previously-transferred malicious file.
data.contents: process.path ends with '\\sc.exe' AND process.command_line contains 'create' AND process.command_line contains '\\\\'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

data.name: GoDaddy Scripts Created by Office Applications
data.description: Detects the creation of script files that are often dropped by malicious Office macros and other document exploits.
data.contents: (process.path ends with 'winword.exe' OR process.path ends with 'excel.exe' OR process.path ends with 'outlook.exe') AND group((file.operation is 'create' OR file.operation is 'rename') AND (file.path ends with '.ps1' OR file.path ends with '.vbs'))

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Visual Basic
Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

data.name: GoDaddy Shim Database Persistence
data.description: Detects when a file is created to execute a suspicious shim binary.
data.contents: group(file.operation is 'create' AND file.path contains '\\apppatch' AND file.path contains '.sdb' AND file.path contains NOT '\\Custom')

data.name: GoDaddy Suspicious JavaScript Execution
data.description: Detects usage of the RUNDLL32.EXE or MSHTA.EXE utilities to execute JavaScript. Often used by "fileless" malware to dynamically pass and execute code at runtime.
data.contents: (process.path ends with 'rundll32.exe' OR process.path contains 'mshta.exe') AND process.command_line contains 'javascript:'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

data.name: GoDaddy Suspicious Network Connections from Windows Processes
data.description: Detects uncommon network connections to ports 80 or 443 initiated by native Windows processes that typically do not connect to these ports.
data.contents: (process.path ends with '\\mshta.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\regsvr32.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\certutil.exe') AND (network.port is '80' OR network.port is '443') AND process.parent_command_line contains NOT '\\amazonAssistantService.exe'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

data.name: GoDaddy Suspicious PowerShell Launched by WMI
data.description: Detect anomalous execution of PowerShell by the WMI hosting process (WMIPRVSE.EXE). This technique is often utilized in Office macro payloads.
data.contents: (process.path ends with '\\powershell.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\pwsh.exe') AND (network.port is '80' OR network.port is '443') AND process.parent_path ends with '\\wmiprvse.exe' AND process.parent_command_line contains NOT '\\CCM' AND process.command_line contains NOT '\\CCM'

data.name: GoDaddy Suspicious PowerShell Command Line
data.description: Detects execution of the PowerShell script interpreter with command line arguments that are often used to load and run malicious code.
data.contents: ((process.path ends with '\\powershell.exe' OR process.path ends with '\\pwsh.exe') AND (process.command_line contains 'wscript.shell' OR process.command_line contains 'FromBase64String' OR process.command_line contains 'WebRequest' OR process.command_line contains 'Sockets.TCPClient' OR (process.command_line contains 'Webclient' AND process.command_line contains 'http') OR (process.command_line contains 'IO' AND process.command_line contains 'Stream') OR (process.command_line contains 'encoding' AND process.command_line contains 'GetString') OR (process.command_line contains '-com' AND process.command_line contains 'transformNode') OR process.command_line contains 'Assembly.Load' OR process.command_line contains '^')) AND process.parent_path ends with NOT '\\Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection\\SenseIR.exe' AND process.parent_path ends with NOT '\\QualysAgent.exe'

data.name: GoDaddy Phishing URLs
data.description: Phishing URL's. The list of URL's have been identified by IR as malicious
data.contents: network.dns_query contains 'vdi-godaddy.com' OR network.dns_query contains 'godaddy-servicenow.com' OR network.dns_query contains ' ticket-servicenow.com' OR network.dns_query contains 'internal-godaddy.com'

data.id: Createdump Used to Create Process MiniDump
data.name: Createdump Used to Create Process MiniDump
data.description: Detects the use of createdump.exe to create a process minidump. This can be used by attackers to image lsass memory that contains credentials as well as other processes memory that contains sensitive data of value.
data.contents: process.path ends with '\\createdump.exe' AND process.command_line contains '-u' AND process.command_line contains '-f'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

data.id: Modification of SSH Authorized Keys File
data.name: Modification of SSH Authorized Keys File
data.description: Detects changes to .ssh/authorized_keys which has been seen as a technique used by several malware families.
data.contents: group((file.operation is 'create' OR file.operation is 'write') AND file.path contains '/.ssh/authorized_keys')

data.name: RegSvr32 Registering OCX Files
data.description: Detects the use of regsvr32 to register .ocx modules to execute the code. This can be used to load and execute malicious code.
data.contents: process.path ends with '\\regsvr32.exe' AND process.command_line contains '.ocx'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

data.name: Wlrmdr Spawned Executable
data.description: Detects wlrmdr.exe being used to execute a binary. Attackers can use this feature to perform indirect execution to evade some detection mechanisms.
data.contents: process.path ends with '\\wlrmdr.exe' AND process.command_line contains '-a' AND process.command_line contains '11' AND process.command_line contains '-u'

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Windows Command Shell

labels.name: Alpha

labels.description: These signals have been tested and reviewed internally for syntax. Internal testing of expected alert generation has been verified. Testing on internal systems for false positives has been conducted and tuned if necessary. These signals are included on the external feed.
labels.name: Beta

labels.description: These are vetted signals that have been tested and used at scale. Large amounts of false positives are not expected. These signals are included on the external feed.
